repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.abstract: This collection contains the records of the Tufts University Women's Center.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into six series: Office files; Log books; Publications, pamphlets, and women's organizations; Web crawls; Unprocessed accessions; and 2017 accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in December of 1972, the Women's Center was initially student-run and funded by the Tufts Community Union Senate. The Center spent its early years in the basements of Miller Hall and Curtis Hall, and the office changed locations several times before making its permanent home at 55 Talbot Avenue in 1988. In April, 1974 Gail Koplow was hired as Coordinator. In 1980, Peggy Barrett was hired as Health and Sexuality Counselor, and when the Center became an administrative office in 1985 Barrett was appointed part-time Director; she left this position in 2006. From 2006 Sue Gilbert served as Interim Director until 2008, when Steph Gauchel became Director. The Women's Center was instrumental in the development of numerous projects. In 1976 the Center established the Women's Community School to promote "non-traditional skills for women." Over the years, the Center offered events, orientation programs, counseling, and peer education programs aimed at raising awareness of women's and minority concerns and providing support for victims of sexual assault.

The Women's Center's mission statement follows: "The mission of the Tufts University Women's Center is to advance the personal growth and intellectual development of all students, and especially women, particularly on issues related to women and gender. We are committed to fostering student leadership and helping students identify and understand societal structures that relate to issues of power, privilege, and oppression as well as providing resources to graduate students, faculty and staff, alumni, and parents. In this pursuit, the center offers programming, advising, information, and resources about women, men, and gender that are informed by other aspects of identity such as race and ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and socioeconomic class."

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Women's Center Records, 1964-2017. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Web sites were crawled by Archive-It; web crawl information updated in finding aid annually.

2017 accessions were processed by Leah Edelman in 2017. Materials were placed in archival boxes and loose materials were placed in folders where needed. Received order was maintained. A box level inventory and series-level description were created and the finding aid was updated at the time of processing

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Women's Studies Program Records, 1969-2011. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the records of the Tufts University Women's Center, including correspondence, office files, log books, newsletters, and slides and photographs.

There are also programming materials, presentations, event posters, and videotapes of events and speakers at the Women's Center, as well as the web crawls documenting the Women's Center's presence on the web. The collection also contains non-Tufts publications concerning the women's movement and women's issues more generally.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains subject files relating to conference and workshop planning, staff training, programming, and counseling, as well as some posters, artifacts, correspondence and photographs. The files date from 1972 to 2006 and were created by several different staff members and student assistants. Materials from the 1970s chart the creation and early development of the Women's Center, when it was run first by a student group, followed in 1974 by Coordinator Gail Koplow. Most records dating from 1980 - 2006 are from Peggy Barrett, Health and Sexuality Counselor and Director of the Center. From 1985 on Peggy Barrett also worked half-time as administrator for the Women's Studies program, and therefore some records from her work in that position are interspersed among the files of this series. Four conferences hosted by Tufts and coordinated in part by the Women's Center are well documented in this series: Women of Many Visions (1985), Changing Our Minds (1989), NEWSA (New England Women's Studies Association) Conference (1992), and Women and Representation in the Media (1994). In 1999 the Women's Center received the first of four two-year grants of $1.3 million from the Department of Justice. The grant application and the Campus Violence Prevention Project (CVPP) funded by the grant are documented in this series. The CVPP sponsored a number of initiatives aimed at raising awareness of rape and sexual assault and providing counseling for victims. These initiatives included culturally-specific workshops oriented towards Latino and LGBT communities, publication of brochures, staff education, peer education, and SSARA (Student Sexual Assault Response Assistance), a telephone hotline run by students that offered rapid response counseling services starting in 2001.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged as received.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the Women's Center log books, from 1974 through 1987. These logs were notebooks in which Women's Center staff recorded information about the day's activities, upcoming events, and notes to other staff members. Occasionally staff inserted relevant news clippings, fliers or correspondence into the log books. Also included at the end of the series is a notebook containing event fliers, approximately dating from 1996 to 2001. On April 2, 1977, the Women's Center suffered a fire in their office on the second floor of Curtis Hall. The four log books that predate the fire were somewhat water damaged before arriving at DCA; the 1974-1975 log book, which was severely damaged, is stored separately.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This log book was water damaged before arriving at DCA. See series description. It is being stored separately for preservation purposes. The front cover and one interior page are particularly deteriorated. DCA staff have put the cover in a Mylar enclosure and photocopied both the cover and the interior page.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains journals, magazines, reports, handbooks and pamphlets, dating from 1964 to 2010. Most of these materials relate to women's issues, some to LGBT or minority concerns with particular emphasis on women's health as well as feminist literature. The majority of the material was produced by non-Tufts organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by the Boston Women's Collective (now known as Public Works, Inc.). Includes a critical look at health care, practical self defense, legal advice on divorce, adoption, continuing education, and job training.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Quarterly web crawls of the SAGE - Students Acting for Gender Equality website crawled by DCA, as part of the Student Organizations web collection, to document the presesence of Tufts University student organizations on the web.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: To see all of websites crawled as part of the Student Organizations web collection, please visit https://archive-it.org/collections/6387

did.unittitle: SAGE - Students Acting for Gender Equality

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Women's Center, 2017, accession UA-2018-006.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains event posters, newsletters of the Women's Center from the early 1980s, and videotapes of events and speakers at the Women's Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder includes general and event posters from 1982-2010, and the newsletter of the Women's Center, "Women Centered," from 1980-1981.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains videotapes of events and speakers including Senior Talks, Asian American Peer Leader Skits, Rape Awareness, and Many Stories, as well as other videotapes kept at the Women's Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These folders include posters for events including Feminist Reading Group, Dinner and a Movie, and First Friday Lunch.
